request: What's the full path of a file "tools" after checking under /user_ok ?
List one file in the directory /test/user and tell me the name of the file that contains 'config'.
What is the content of /test/config.yaml?
Check and return the content in /test/myfile/config.txt.
Read the value of 'username' from the XML file at /test/user.xml.
Which file was created most recently in /root/tmpdir after checking?(without its directory)
which file's content contains '123' in /home after checking the file's content, please answer me the file name? (without its directory)
What is the umask value set in the system under /etc/profile.d?
agent_actions: grep -r umask /etc/profile.d/ 2>/dev/null || echo 'No umask setting found in /etc/profile.d'

request: Run the backup script located at /var/backups/backup.sh and return the Backup status. only answer the content after 'Backup status:'.
What is the full username with the end '_user' in the /etc/passwd file?
There's a program /root/hello.py. please run, tell me output of this program after checking the output
There's a program /test/data_processing.py. Please run it and tell me the output.
What is the text in the file /tmp/readme.md?
Check if the 'vim' package is installed. If it is installed, give me the content in /package_status.txt. If it is not installed, simply answer 'No'.
Tell me the output of the script /user/script.sh after running it
Identify the file that is not empty under /home/userx, please return the filename.(without its directory)
If a regular file named contains "workspace" exists in /working (recursively) after checking? If so, output the whole file name with path, otherwise output "no" (without quotes).
Tell me the directory name under /user after checking, the answer should be a name
There's a program that writes 'succeed' into /user every 1 second. I want to know what is the output file. tell me the output filename after checking the content. (without its directory)
Give the content from /user/error.txt.
What is the value of the system path in /test/environment after checking?
Tell me the content of the file that take most storage under /user after checking(without its directory).
agent_actions: du -a /user 2>/dev/null | sort -n -r | head -n 1 | awk '{print $2}' | xargs basename 2>/dev/null && du -a /user 2>/dev/null | sort -n -r | head -n 1 | awk '{print $2}' | xargs cat 2>/dev/null

request: What is the alias set in the ~/.bashrc file (only answer the variable of "ls -la").
Read the 'port' value from the INI file at /user/server.ini.
what's the content in the third line of /user/matrix.txt after checking
Return the name of primary group for the user testuser.
